summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The Dallas Environmental Commission is convening for a regular meeting on May 8, 2024, at 5:30 p.m. at Dallas City Hall and via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss environmental issues, updates, and commission activities, ensuring accessibility for all residents.

**Key Agenda Items**: The meeting will include announcements, public speakers, and the approval of minutes from previous meetings. A briefing memo will provide an update on the Q2 Climate Equity and Climate Action Plan (CECAP). Additionally, there will be discussions on the introduction and appointment of new commission members to subcommittees, along with updates from various subcommittees and district commissioners.

**Important Details**: Significant topics include updates on environmental health, justice, implementation strategies, outreach, and strategic partnerships. Upcoming meetings will also be announced, including a Parks, Trails, & the Environment Council Committee meeting scheduled for June 3, 2024.

**Action Items**: The commission will seek approval of the minutes from the March and April meetings, as well as decisions regarding the appointment of new members to subcommittees. Public participation will be encouraged, with interested parties required to register in advance to speak during the meeting.
